page.title: 06WHITEHILL
page.content: Whitehill is a private housing estate situated in the north-west of our study region. At the entrance there are 2 very big houses and smaller ones further down the estate. Some houses are detached and the rest are semi-detached which all have windows in the roofs called skylights or attic windows. Whitehill is a very modern housing estate and the first phase is about 4 to 5 years old. Most of the houses are completed and being lived in, but there are still some wich are being built at the moment. Its nickname is "Cornflake Hill" because it is said that when the people have paid their mortgage they have not enough money to buy food, so they live on cornflakes. Before Whitehill was built the land was used for farming. WRITTEN BY BARBARA (aged 11)
